page.title: 04ENNERDALE _ Tourism.
page.content: The area attracts a great many visitors each year.Visitors are quite happy to leave their cars at the car park provided and enjoy quiet walks along the valley,or take advantage of the many forest walks or trails that have been provided by the forestry commission.Two popular walks are the Smithy Beck Trail which follows along the forest at the end of the river and the Nine Becks Walk which makes a circular tour taking in Nine Becks Walk of the Lake District and the Ramblers Association provided the foot bridges .in 1979 100,000 people are estimated to have visited the area.There are picnic areas provided along the trails.The more adventurous and stout harted may prefer to climb above the forest and go to Red Pike. this is the highest point of the grid square at a height of 756m.It has
